body.p: A Kentucky attorney, farmer, and politician. Engaged in agriculture, studied law, and admitted to the bar in 1849.Practiced law in Monticello, Kentucky. Married to Lucy Nelson Bell Chrisman. Father of Alice Chrisman, Amelia B. Chrisman, Micah T. Chrisman, Fannie Chrisman, Lucy D. Chrisman, Jimonie Chrisman, Cabell P. Chrisman, and Frances Esler Chrisman Brown. Served as a member of the 1849 Kentucky Constitutional Convention from Wayne County, Kentucky. Served the Fourth Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States House of Representative from 1853 to 1855. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served the Fifth Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.
